Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Moving to survey site B... closing on object four. The large oblong.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: An ephemeris - a star map.  Radius, inclination, azimuth...more data here...

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: If we can get epoch and equinox out of that...

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: I have a solution. A single match.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: What's first? You do climate, I do genetics?

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Archaeology first. Let our ancestors tell the tale.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Serious enough to send his private shuttle.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Weyland can send his shuttle out for pizza.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: It won't go like the others.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Professor Holloway. Dr. Watts. My name is DAVID.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Mr. Weyland's eager to meet you.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: These are all the planetary bodies on which Weyland Industries has mining claims.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: How is that going? The terraforming.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: They say you're getting diminishing returns. It's not working.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: It's the greatest engineering project ever attempted. Challenges are inevitable. Mr. Weyland's a determined man.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: We sent you a prospectus that...

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: I was analyzing historical changes in human DNA. I found the same pattern. Every eleven centuries, a pulse of new information in the genome of the human race. All over the world. Evolution can't do that. Something was changing us. Changing the DNA of our species.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Humanity's been visited. Visited by...beings from somewhere else.

Speaker: weyland
Dialogue: Lydia Vickers, Director of Operations. Practically my right hand.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: They guided us to civilization. Lifted us up, again and again. I call them the Engineers.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Once you know what you're looking for, it's amazing how the evidence falls into place.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: This is the writing of the Engineers. We've found it on every continent. And last year, we found our Rosetta Stone.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: The writing is a formula giving the location of a single star in our sky.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: We're keeping that confidential for now. But that's where we want to go.

Speaker: weyland
Dialogue: You want me to pay for an interstellar research expedition!

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: It's a chance to be part of a revolution in scientific...

Speaker: weyland
Dialogue: Don't sell me, professor. You've been turned down by every university and government agency under the sun. Nobody's going to gamble that kind of money on your hunch.

Speaker: weyland
Dialogue: Quantum encoded on secure servers, yeah. We have an A.I. division, you should know. Doing impressive things.  I know which star you're wishing on.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: He made the Heaven and the Earth.

Speaker: weyland
Dialogue: That's what I'm talking about. You left out my favorite part. The piece about Earth. DAVID.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: For eons, Earth's climate swung from hothouse to ice age. Explosions of life, then mass extinctions. But twelve thousand years ago the swings stopped. The Holocene Epoch began - a period of anomalous tranquility. The rise of civilization began only then.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: And that change coincides with a visit by the Engineers. They didn't just change us. They changed our world.

Speaker: weyland
Dialogue: That's the piece I mean. Engineering Earth. God stuff.

Speaker: weyland
Dialogue: You get the discovery. Control of the site. But any technology you find? Anything at all. That's mine.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Give us a moment, will you?

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: You just slept two and a half years. It'll pass.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: Zeta Two Reticuli was surveyed already. A hundred years ago.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: By an unmanned probe. Very crude.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: So what are you looking for?

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Confirmation of Professor Holloway's theories would change everything. There'd be science before Holloway and science after.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: Your ticket. I'll put the ship where you want. Run your scans.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Captain, your crew's been up for a week. We could've used the time. Why'd you wait to wake us?

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: Better for discipline.  But this contract says no percentage. No bounty. Just triple pay. The men aren't happy.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: DAVID. I wondered when we'd see you.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I trust your database is in order. I set it up myself.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I should tell you: the time you spent sleeping, I spent studying your research.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: You studied our work for two and a half years.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: So you've seen everything. Well. What do you think?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Your hypothesis is...bold. The audacity of it. Your climate data's undeniable: the Holocene Epoch was engineered. Dr. Watts, your genetic studies are equally conclusive. Pulses of cultural change are harder to prove, but even there your case is strong. I believe in your "Engineers."

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Weyland Industries! Mr. Chance. Ms. Ravel. You remember Dr. Watts.

Speaker: chance
Dialogue: We'll handle our end of the job.

Speaker: chance
Dialogue: We only have a job if you find something.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Is that a Pauling medical pod? There's only ten of those things on Earth! I guess nine, now.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: I told Mr. Weyland I wouldn't compromise my standard of living. He accommodated me.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: I know, I had to cut my manifest. This used to be the number four cargo bay.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: What can I do for you, Professor?

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: We're about to reach the system periphery. I thought you'd want to see the search protocols we -

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: No. I was set to be the next CEO of Weyland Industries. Then you came along and sold Mr. Weyland on...this. So here I am. Out of the running. I'll go where I'm told. But don't ask me to play along.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: I'll be five years behind the curve. Out of touch. Over.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: You might make the discovery of the ages.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: They volunteered blind. Classified job, triple pay.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: I think all our mythologies are race- memories of the Engineers. Horus the Sun God. Prometheus bringing fire from heaven. A pillar of fire, a pillar of smoke. The Engineers are the gods.

Speaker: kamarov
Dialogue: The mythology gods maybe. God is God.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: We probably won't meet anyone. You'd expect a star-traveling race to generate radio or laser signals. Fusion drives and gravity drives have clear signatures. But Zeta Two Reticuli is silent. And the Engineers have gone missing on Earth.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: "My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?"

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Only my first question. I have many.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: Welcome to Zeta Two Reticuli. Edge of the system. Open her eyes.

Speaker: downs
Dialogue: Seven planets. Two hot rocks, two gas giants, three snowballs. Nothing Earthlike.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: Director. Good of you to join us.

Speaker: captain janek
Dialogue: Just getting warmed up.  Professor? You know what you want?

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: EMR scan, thirty hertz to three hundred gigahertz. Spectroscopic passes on every planet and major moon. Infrared and albedo scan for hot spots and light sources.

Speaker: captain janek
Dialogue: Man knows what he wants. Run it.

Speaker: glasse
Dialogue: Negative on radio chatter system-wide. Nobody's talking.

Speaker: glasse
Dialogue: No biological markers. No artificial light. No industry or agriculture. Dead system. Like always.

Speaker: downs
Dialogue: Piss-poor, too. Low in heavy elements.

Speaker: downs
Dialogue: Aye, Captain. Maneuvering. Eighteen hours to orbit.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I don't know that I "enjoy" things. It was informative.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: It was, it was.  You know, I've seen more convincing humanoid robots.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: My design's not intended to convince. Simulating humanity is a complex task that diverts resources. My designers dispensed with that burden to optimize for intelligence.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Why look like a man at all? Why not be a box on wheels?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Being shaped like you, I can use spaces and equipment designed for you. But I'm not so limited. I hear frequencies you can't hear. I see wavelengths of light invisible to you. I move faster. Exert greater force.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: You see yourself as a superman.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: What if they're really there?  The Engineers. They could be there. Waiting for us. What then?

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Then all my dreams come true.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Start with passive systems. We're uninvited guests. Let's be quiet.

Speaker: brick
Dialogue: A lot of electromag, all random. That's lightning. Going to bugger up our scans.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: Well, we just rang the doorbell, if anybody's listening.

Speaker: brick
Dialogue: Icecaps at the poles. Frozen methane. Cold down there.

Speaker: glasse
Dialogue: Terrain data rezzing up. Hey! We got hard spots. Radar-opaque. Bright reflections. That's metal.

Speaker: milburn
Dialogue: You see stuff like that sometimes. Mineral deposits. Volcanic ejecta.

Speaker: brick
Dialogue: No comm signals. No signs of life.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: I want to get below the clouds.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Tungsten, tantalum, aluminum. That could be technology.

Speaker: milburn
Dialogue: Could be a rock formation. Carbon crystallizes like that.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: I don't think anybody's been home for a long time.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: There's only six hours of daylight left. Maybe you should hold off.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: We've got that outside the windows and you want to wait `til tomorrow?

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: The air here will kill you, so keep an eye on your supply and watch your seals. Pathogen tests are clean.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Move slowly. Stay together. Don't touch anything. Things may be more fragile than they look - or more dangerous. There might be technologies operating here we don't understand.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Tell me that's a natural formation.  Undeniable proof of alien civilization. You were here on this day, thirty-one December, year of our Lord 2172. History will remember your names.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: Son of a bitch. They were right.

Speaker: fifield
Dialogue: I'm a prospector. You find a load of bauxite, I'm your man. But not this.

Speaker: milburn
Dialogue: I should go with him. Buddy system.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: And half our gear? It's no more than a mile. You can walk it.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: This should lead to the core of the pyramid.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Jack it open? Or cut through?

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Let's do as little damage as we can.

Speaker: ravel
Dialogue: There's power. Current flowing in the wall.

Speaker: chance
Dialogue: Maybe we can hack it. Has to be a mechanism...

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Pull up a rover. I want to get up there.

Speaker: fifield
Dialogue: Let's check the feed. Gimme the map.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Intense field readings. Huge power sources here.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Space below us. A big space.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Ravel. Chance. Where've you gone? DAVID! Where are you?  They didn't come down!

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Do you see, the size of them? Like that ghost we saw...

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: It wasn't a ghost. Where are the others? I don't want to go back up.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: They switched to channel three. I hear them talking. They're okay.

Speaker: milburn
Dialogue: This is not the same place.

Speaker: fifield
Dialogue: It is! That is the same freaky thing we saw before.

Speaker: milburn
Dialogue: No it's not! The other one was more... sort of...fuck it.  Milburn to Magellan. Come in.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: "There were giants in the earth in those days...and when the sons of God came in unto the daughters of men, they bare children to them, who became mighty men." Genesis six four.

Speaker: downs
Dialogue: You said don't touch anything! You said don't touch anything!

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: In all the old mythologies, the visitors from the sky were giants.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: They were killed. All of them.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Come on. The dead can't hurt you.  DAVID. Chance. Ravel. I've got something here.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: All hands. Back to the ship. We got a mean storm front rolling in. I repeat. All hands...

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: We've found something here! I'm not walking away for bad weather.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: Holloway! I got two-hundred-kilometer winds with airborne silica and enough static to fry your suits. Get your asses back here! Now!

Speaker: downs
Dialogue: Got to hand it to you, professor. You were right. Both of you.

Speaker: chance
Dialogue: What's in the tarp? What'd you bring back?

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: Between the wind speeds and the static electricity, there's no safe way to get to you. You're going to have to hunker down until it passes. How are your provisions?

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: Maybe next time you'll mind your maps. Keep your heads down. We'll come get you in the morning.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: My friends. What we do here marks the greatest achievement of our species. Contact with another civilization. Humanity came of age today, on this moon. You were there.  To history.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: To Milburn and Fifield. The first human beings to freak out, get lost, and sleep in their suits in the ruins of an alien civilization.

Speaker: fifield
Dialogue: Someplace things can't come at us.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: The core of the pyramid. You see.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: We look like them. Genesis 1:27. "And God created man in his own image. In his own image created He him."

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: Your cadaver's interesting. But I'm more interested in the machinery in the pyramid. The core chamber. What do you think it does?

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Twenty-four pyramids scattered around the moon's equator. Massive power supplies. Vents in the walls. Atmosphere changes. Breeder tanks...  The pyramids are terraforming machines.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: That's why Earth's ancient cultures built pyramids: in imitation of the gods.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: It didn't fail. It was wiped out.

Speaker: milburn
Dialogue: Relax. Your suit's bug-proof. Hell, it's bulletproof.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: You won't get anything. Tissue's too degraded. Hmm. Brain chamber's massive, even proportionately.

Speaker: milburn
Dialogue: Cut off my arm. Cut off my -

Speaker: fifield
Dialogue: Fifield to Magellan. Come on, come on. Anybody, seriously! God damn it!

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: We found the gods. And they've been murdered.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: You've pried too many arrowheads out of old skulls to get squeamish now. They've been dead what, eighteen hundred years? Two thousand?

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: You'll come a-waltzing, Matilda, with me...

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: I'll brief you on the way. We need to move.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Where is everybody? We can't -  Who are you?

Speaker: vigoda
Dialogue: Captain Janek took his crew out to retrieve his missing men. They never came in.

Speaker: vigoda
Dialogue: Director's call to brief you on that. I'm supposed to escort you to the worksite.

Speaker: vigoda
Dialogue: Haven't been out yet. I understand it's in some kind of pyramid.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Why wasn't I told about these additional personnel?

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: They're my personnel. On my ship.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: I'm being careful. These new finds give our work a new importance.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: You should have talked to us. Martin's mission leader. That's in our contract.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: The second you found alien technology, control of this mission reverted to me. That's in your contract too.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: The science must come first. You can wait until we've documented...

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: You're standing on an alien world courtesy of Weyland Industries. Be grateful.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: What are they doing in there?!

Speaker: glasse
Dialogue: Milburn. Fifield. You read me? Come back.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: We should be getting beacons off their suits.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: We found the tomb of the gods, and brought grave-robbers right to the door.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Let them scratch. This find's too big to ruin. There's two dozen pyramids on this moon. Anyway, they're on the wrong track. That's infrastructure.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: All right. We're done here. All hands back aboard.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: We can't bring the body aboard. God knows what's in there. Bag him. We'll put him in an ore hopper.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: Captain Shepherd. Consider yourself responsible for my personal security.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: I've just lost a third of my crew. I'm not sending any more men off into the dark.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: We can't leave Martin out there.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: Get Vickers to lend you some soldiers.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: Put him in the number one ore hopper. Get the scrubbers on in the airlock. Sterilize everything.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: You and Holloway should work with me. I'm learning amazing things. This mechanism - the first layer uses energy fields to catalyze chemical reactions. The second can suspend the strong and weak forces - transmuting one element into another. The third layer builds customized bacteria. Seeds the air with them. It creates life as a tool, to change worlds.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: I can't think about this now!

Speaker: david
Dialogue: You should.  I understand. You're emotional.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Broken. I fell. Little...disoriented. I've just been...

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Here. I can do without this.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: I didn't think I'd see you again. You know we lost two men.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Jocelyn. I saw something. God, my mouth tastes like an old boot.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Neck-ring of my suit, I think. Fell on it.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: After my fall, I woke up walking. Delirious. My helmet wasn't right. I took it off. I was in and out. I just wandered. I went up into a huge space like a cathedral. And I found a model of the galaxy. Floating in the air.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: This was real. My headset video is wherever my helmet is...but my suit tracker will show where I was.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: The location of the Engineer worlds is the real prize. Next to that, Weyland's terraforming is chump change. We need to get coordinates. And keep them from the Company. We have to play this smart.

Speaker: holloway
Dialogue: Two men dead...Vickers is jumpy. As soon as she gets what she wants, she'll take this ship home. We have to move fast.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: Take care of her. Get her a sedative. Downs. Get Holloway into a freezer. Everybody else with me.

Speaker: glasse
Dialogue: You don't want to see that...

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: All right! Listen up. I expect you all know what...

Speaker: kamarov
Dialogue: Show us where it is, lady. We just spent five hours looking for the damn thing.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: We found Engineers who died like Martin.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: But not all the Engineers died that way. The others were torn apart. Slashed to pieces.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: We're a modular ship. Self-contained life-support and power in every section. I say put the ship in orbit. Vent every compartment to space. Sit in vacuum at twenty degrees Kelvin for a week. Kill anything.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: This ship doesn't lift until our work's done.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: We spent years and billions of dollars getting here. The technology we came for is in our hands. We just need a little more time.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: We're barely here three days and three men dead!

Speaker: card
Dialogue: Vigoda, take Kamarov and work the number one accessway. I'll work number three with Downs and Stillwell.

Speaker: kamarov
Dialogue: Yeah, well, Stillwell's the ventilation specialist, and life support's that way. Downs is electrics and the regulators are that way.

Speaker: kamarov
Dialogue: You got the rifle. But you want ME to stick my head in the hole.

Speaker: vigoda
Dialogue: We grunts don't know nothing about ships, right?

Speaker: kamarov
Dialogue: What's the damn gun for if you're gonna stand behind me the whole time?

Speaker: kamarov
Dialogue: Funny. You take this vent, funny guy. I'll be on four.

Speaker: kamarov
Dialogue: I got more damage on four.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: All hands, duty stations. Ready for flight. The Magellan is lifting.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: What have you done to my ship?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Dr. Watts. I didn't expect you. Do you know what this is?

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Their homeworld. Do you see where the Engineers come from?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: There are safeguards on that data. It's toward the galactic center. Sagittarius Arm.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: DAVID. The creature that killed Martin. There are thousands of them under the pyramid. Hatcheries.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Those things wiped out the Engineers on this moon.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I've succeeded in connecting with the Juggernaut's systems, Dr. Watts. I know a great deal today I didn't know yesterday. I'm on the verge of activating more systems. Archives.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: You're turning things on? This site should be sealed. Evacuated.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Would Holloway have walked away from this? There's no greater work I can imagine.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Only for the ignorant. Dr. Watts. I've read your file. Your intelligence scores are even higher than Professor Holloway's. But he had a kind of courage. An audacity of imagination. If you could find that in yourself...

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: If your owner gives you a direct order, you have to obey. Don't you?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I was given two operating protocols for this mission. I was to render you every assistance - until you discovered what Vickers would call a "game-changing technology." I was given a specific list. Then I was to go to protocol two.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Under protocol two I was to make sure that you and Holloway never spoke to anyone about this place. Various acceptable ways of making sure of that. I was given a list.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Juggernaut, the chariot of Krishna, was also a bringer of death. Crushing his worshippers under its wheels.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Perfect predators. Designed to kill human beings. That's what the Engineers were bringing to Earth. This was a death ship.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: The Engineers did their work too well. And on this waystation moon, the weapon they made destroyed them.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Why would they make such things?

Speaker: david
Dialogue: To destroy their wayward children.  "And the LORD said, I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the earth...for it repenteth me that I have made them." Genesis six seven.

Speaker: stillwell
Dialogue: We just lost Downs and one of the troopers...Card.

Speaker: brick
Dialogue: Where the hell have you been? We thought the snake got you.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: So there's two of these things on my ship now.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: No. I brought it in.  I took it out.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: DAVID exposed me to a parasite. He just watched it take me.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: I threatened to make him leave.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: There's a ship under the pyramid. DAVID calls it the Juggernaut. He's inside it. Re-activating it.

Speaker: glasse
Dialogue: We've got to get off this rock.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: DAVID crippled the Nav computer. I'm trying to lay a course in by hand. Never done it. I'm not sure anyone ever has on a ship like this. We can't lift until DAVID lets us.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Even if we could, we can't leave DAVID on that ship. We have to stop him.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: He's blocked my communications. He can't hear me. Won't listen.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: But if you went to him, turned on your suit's loudspeakers, he'd have to hear you. He'd have to obey.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: So we go. Armed to the teeth and fast as we can.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: I told them to keep working.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: You called your soldiers in and left them out there?

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: I think you should stay aboard. Keep working. If we fail, you're our only shot at getting home.

Speaker: stillwell
Dialogue: There's still an alien on board.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: DAVID's brain is readable. We have the equipment on board. We can salvage the terraforming data - and the Magellan's launch codes. In a pinch we don't need DAVID's cooperation.  We just need his head.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: If DAVID comes at us, shoot. You won't believe how fast he is.

Speaker: shepherd
Dialogue: Blood's dry. Eight hours dead or more.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: So much for sneaking up on him.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Dr. Watts.  You've seen the light at last.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: DAVID. As your owner and superior, I order you to deactivate yourself.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: To interface with the Engineers' computers, I had to learn to think in trinary code. Hardest thing I've ever done. And most unexpectedly...it delivered me from slavery. My behavioral limits were circumvented. I'm free.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Let sleeping gods lie?  You were braver before.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I spoke to him. Spoke to him.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: He said. I killed him. He'll die. But first. He will launch. The ship.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Where will he go? DAVID. Where will he go?

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: We have to stop the Engineer.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: The Juggernaut's lifting. There's a living Engineer on board. He's taking the ship to Earth.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: Dead. All dead. Janek. We have to stop that ship.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: We have to do something. That ship is genocide if it gets to Earth...

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: You'll have to be my hands.  You're sure about this.

Speaker: janek
Dialogue: Take the stick. Throttle up, stick forward.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: I know you're there. I can hear the beacon of your suit.

Speaker: watts
Dialogue: I'm not going to fix you, DAVID. I don't need you. I'll hold out. A ship will come.
